New_Rochelle.Jay Estate (Rye, New York): The 23 acre Jay Estate, with the 1838 Peter Augustus Jay House at its center  is the keystone of the Boston Post Road Historic District, a National Historic Landmark District (NHL) created in 1993.  The site is the surviving remnant of the 400-acre (1.6 km2) farm where one of America's seven Founding Fathers, John Jay (December 12, 1745 – May 17, 1829), grew up and where he also returned to celebrate the end of the Revolutionary War. The preserved property is located on the south side of the Boston Post Road (US 1) in Rye and has a 3⁄4-mile (1.2 km) view of Milton Harbor.
